title: Copy protection
custom_preconds:
1) User logged into a account.
2) The Roku hooked up to a recording device. (Ninja, El Gato capture hardware, etc.)
custom_steps:
1) Launch the PS Vue channel.
2) Progress to the home menu.
3) Start playback of any movie or show.
custom_expected:
The user sees template that blocks the ability to record video playback.

*(Currently the user hears audio and see captions, need to see if this is as designed.)

title: Verify: PS Vue can be accessed while the Roku is connected wirelessly
custom_preconds:
1) Roku connected to a wireless network.
2) PS Vue channel installed
custom_steps: 1) Launch the "Playstation Vue" channel from the "Home" Menu on the Roku
custom_expected: The channel should launch.

title: Verify: PS Vue can be accessed while the Roku is connected to a wired connection
custom_preconds:
1) Roku connected to a wired network.
2) PS Vue channel installed.
custom_steps: 1) Launch the "Playstation Vue" channel from the "Home" Menu on the Roku
custom_expected: The channel should launch.

title: All Live TV: Make sure all live tv programing available to the logged in account appears
custom_preconds: User logged into a valid account.
custom_steps:
1) From the Roku "Home" screen select the "PlayStation Vue" Channel.
2) Navigate the Main Menu/Home screen to the "Live TV" section.
3) Navigate left or right to the "See All Live TV" tile and select it.
4) Navigate through the shows/movies.
custom_expected:
1) The user should see all programming currently live for the account level they are logged into.
2) If any shows/movies are added to "My Shows" and currently airing they should appear at the top under "Favorites".
 - If no shows are added to "My Shows" or non of the added shows are airing, the favorites section should not appear at top.
 - If shows are added to "My Shows" and are currently airing they should appear at the top under "Favorites" and the rest of the currently running content should appear under that.

title: Verify text and formatting is clear and readable
custom_preconds: User logged into a valid account.
custom_steps:
1) From the Roku "Home" screen select the "PlayStation Vue" channel.
2) Navigate around the channel.
custom_expected: Verify all text and formatting is clear and readable throughout the channel.

title: All Live TV: Make sure all live tv programing available to the logged in account can be played back.
custom_preconds: User logged into a valid account.
custom_steps:
1) From the Roku "Home" screen select the "PlayStation Vue" Channel.
2) Navigate the Main Menu/Home screen to the "Live TV" section.
3) Navigate left or right to the "See All Live TV" tile and select it.
4) Navigate through the shows/movies and start playback of various content.
custom_expected: The selected content plays.

2) Navigate the Main Menu/Home screen and the subsections.
custom_expected: After approximately 5-10 mint he app should refresh. (NEED TO CHECk)

title: User only see's content available to their subscription level. (NMI)
custom_preconds: Need info on all account types.

title: Login: Initial log in screen
custom_preconds: Make sure the user has not logged in yet or is logged out of the channel.
custom_steps: 1) Launch the channel.
custom_expected: The user should see a login screen once the channel is entered. Below the login there will be a link for a site where the user can obtain a subscription for the service.

title: Login: Login Flow (TBD)
custom_preconds: Make sure the user has not logged in yet or is logged out of the channel.
custom_steps:
1) Launch the channel.
2) "PlayStation Vue" splash screen appears.
3) Press "OK" On the remote on the Login screen.
4) User will need to enter their PlayStation Network associated email address.
5) User will need to enter the password for that account.
6) An Activation screen should appear.
7) Profit (auth flow is tbd)
custom_expected: Auth flow tbd. Need to find out if auth code is emailed to the user or given on the channel and entered somewhere.

title: Settings: Log Out
custom_preconds: A user logged into an account.
custom_steps:
1) Launch the PS Vue channel.
2) Progress to the home menu.
3) On the home menu navigate to the bottom last 2 options available.(Settings & Search)
4) Enter the "Settings" menu.
5) Select "Log Out"
custom_expected:
The user will receive a prompt asking if they are sure they want to log out with and option to choose either "Yes" or "No".
 - Selecting "Yes" should log out the user and return the user back to the log in screen.
 - Selecting "No" will close the prompt and the user wll be back in the "Settings" Menu.

title: Episode Context Menu
custom_preconds: A user logged into an account.
custom_steps:
1) Launch the PS Vue channel.
2) Progress to the home menu.
3) Highlight an episodic piece of content.
4) Press the *(star) button on the remote.
custom_expected: Episode context menu appears.

title: Episode Context Menu - Episode Details
custom_preconds: User logged into a a account.
custom_steps:
1) Launch the PS Vue channel.
2) Progress to the home menu.
3) Highlight any content that is a T.V show or part of a series.
4) Press the *(star) button on the remote.
5) Select "Episode Details"
custom_expected:
The user should be taken to a screen with various asset details that gives season, episode, rating, network, if the content is live, and information about the asset.

This view should also let you play the episode and use the "Add to My Shows" option.

title: Episode Context Menu - Series Details
custom_preconds: A user logged into an account.
custom_steps:

2) Progress to the home menu.
3) Highlight any content that is a T.V show or part of a series.
4) Press the *(star) button on the remote.
5) Select "Series Details"
custom_expected: The user will be taken to a screen where they can view other episodes in the season and see "Recommended by Viewers" under the additional series episodes.

title: Home: Make sure all section appear on the Home screen.
custom_preconds: User logged into a valid account.
custom_steps:
1) From the Roku "Home" screen select the "PlayStation Vue" Channel.
2) Navigate the Main Menu/Home screen.
custom_expected:
The user should see the following sections:
Timeline
Live TV
My Shows
Channels
Recommended
Featured 
Search & Settings
